Pre-Game Insights: India finished top of Group 2 with 8 points in 5 matches and a net run rate of 1.319. England were second in Group 1 with 7 points in 5 matches and a net run rate of 0.473.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is for the first time that India and England will cross swords in a T20I match on Australian grounds.
Others: India will bat first against England in the second T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final on Thursday, November 10. The match will start from 1.30 pm (IST) at the Adelaide Oval in Australia.
